item.title: Hooked: A Crucible for Modern Product Design
item.description: When you pick up a book like “Hooked: How to Build Habit-Forming Products” by Nir Eyal, you might expect another prosaic guide on product management, laden with terminology and stale examples. But what unfolds is an insightful examination, a playbook almost, for understanding what makes users click, literally and figuratively. As a tech person but with an artist’s heart, I’ve learned that the real art in any creation, whether it be in code or on canvas, lies in the connection it makes with the audience.
